Title: Requires that an employee, who is transferred from one state agency to another because his or her previous position was eliminated, be entitled to certain benefits
Summary: Provides that an employee whose position is eliminated for certain reasons and who is subsequently transferred to a different agency be entitled to the same hourly salary; retain all accrued sick leave; retain, cash out or use all accrued vacation time; and be paid relocation expenses.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the labor law, in relation to requiring that state agencies must protect salary and benefits of employees whose positions are eliminated as a result of privatization, reorganization, closure or a reduction in work force
